msContents.summary: Abraham del Vecchio's Tiḳune ha-Rif, part I.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 17th century, probably of Solomon Portaleone (see a note on folio 1r, where Samuel Portaleone ascribes this copy to his brother, Solomon).

binding.p: Post-1600. Brown card cover. Spine title: 'Del Vecchio. Tikkune ha-Riph. Part I. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 26,990.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 101: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [200v].
